org.openstreetmap.travelingsalesman.routing.routers
Class MultiTargetDijkstraRouter

java.lang.Object
  org.openstreetmap.travelingsalesman.routing.routers.MultiTargetDijkstraRouter
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPlugin, IRouter
public class MultiTargetDijkstraRouter
extends java.lang.Object
implements IRouter

A simple Dijkstra. We assume:

  • there are no 2 ways between the same 2 nodes.
  • The metric is never negative
  • the metric does only depend on the RoutingStep, not on the step we took before that (e.g.speed-decreased in sharp corners)

Author:
Marcus Wolschon

aStartingPoint - the Node we are now at

null or a list of Segments to use in order to reach the destination

getNextNodes

protected java.util.Collection<Route.RoutingStep> getNextNodes(IDataSet aMap,
                                                               Node aStartingPointToReach,
                                                               Node aCurrentNode,
                                                               java.util.Set<Node> forbiddenNodes,
                                                               Selector aSelector)
Parameters:
aStartingPointToReach - the Node we want to reach
aCurrentNode - where we are (startting at the targets)
forbiddenNodes - the Nodes we already stepped on
aMap - the map to route in
aSelector - the selector giving us the way that are allowed
Returns:
an iterator giving all segments of a node (maybe ordered)
